title: 2. IRRI Agronomy Challenge 2: Transplanting Day (20 December 2012)

subtasks: Understand the benefits of machine transplanting over manual planting.
Research the historical context of machine invention (40 years ago, Japan, Korea, China).
Recognize labor shortages driving adoption in Asia (India, South, East Asia).
Identify business opportunities for small farmers and seedling growers.
Prepare seedling mats with uniform seedlings for machine transplanting.
Address the role of women in seedling production businesses.
Evaluate machine transplanting versus manual methods for specific soil conditions (precise crop establishment, safer technology).
Navigate muddy areas while operating the machine.
Overcome technical issues (engine malfunction, mechanism stuck).
Appreciate the operator's skill and potential improvements.

tasks.task: Plant crops using a machine transplanter.
subtasks: Ensure the machine is operational and user-friendly.
Understand the machine's components and functions.
Prepare the planting site (weeds removal, soil preparation).
Position the machine appropriately for optimal planting.
Load the machine with seedlings or mats.
Engage the machine's planting mechanism and maintain even speed.
Adjust machine settings for different soil conditions.
Tackle challenging terrain (mud, waterlogged areas) with wheels and seedling recovery.
Monitor and address any malfunctions during operation.
Evaluate the quality of planting (spacing, seedling survivability) after completion.
